intro: Bupleurum lipskyanum, commonly known as the Liskyan bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Bupleurum lipskyanum is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and overharvesting.
